etymology.description: 混(mix) + 血(blood) = mixed blood; person of mixed ancestry
etymology.interpretation: Literally “mixed blood”. Refers to a person of mixed ethnic or racial ancestry, or to such ancestry itself.

examples.chinese: 她是中美混血(她是中美混血)。
examples.english: She is of Chinese-American mixed heritage.

examples.chinese: 他的混血背景让他更容易跨文化沟通(他的混血背景讓他更容易跨文化溝通)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de hùn xuè bèijǐng ràng tā gèng róngyì kuà wénhuà gōutōng.
examples.english: His mixed-heritage background makes cross-cultural communication easier.

examples.chinese: 在体育界(在體育界)，许多混血球员表现出色(許多混血球員表現出色)。
examples.pinyin: Zài tǐyù jiè, xǔduō hùn xuè qiúyuán biǎoxiàn chūsè.
examples.english: In the sports world, many mixed-heritage players perform excellently.
